title: WATCH: Bruce Springsteen Launches Guitar Across Stage and Smacks Technician in the Head
description:
Bruce Springsteen has been performing for about six decades now. Which is a very long time. But apparently not long enough to master his guitar throw.

A fan video of Springsteen smacking his longtime technician in the head with his guitar started circulating today. And it wasn't just a light toss. Oh no. Springsteen turned, knees bent, and geared up for a moment before launching that sucker straight into the poor technician's face.

The technician, Kevin Buell, spread his arms wide in an attempt to catch it. He appeared to launch himself forward, overshot the guitar, and missed it with his hands to instead hit it with his head.

\u201cWATCH:\n\nBruce Springsteen throws his guitar during a concert, accidentally striking a technician in the head\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1676574734

Buell immediately collapsed, as one naturally would after being struck with a guitar by The Boss. Springsteen walked over, grinning, to see if Buell was ok, but Buell had already started to leave the stage. Presumably to nurse his sore noggin.

It's not known if Buell suffered any significant injuries. Springsteen suggested all was well quickly when he returned to the mic and jokingly said, "man down!"

The video was taken from Springsteen's February 3rd performance in Atlanta. Springsteen and his E Street Band have been on tour since May of last year, their first tour together since 2017. Other than wounding his technicians, this tour saw Springsteen perform "If I Was the Priest" for the first time since 1972. He explained he wrote the song when he was 22, and he still doesn't "have a clue what the f*ck it’s about.”

Springsteen has previously performed the guitar toss and managed not to maim or injure anyone, in Munich in 2009, and Seattle in 2016. Given that he's 73 years old, it's a wonder he's still touring, let alone launching his guitar across the stage. So perhaps we should cut The Boss some slack. And hope Buell's head is okay.

title: WATCH: Sam Smith Invents New Gender-Neutral Word Because in 2023 Everything is Offensive
description:
I once wrote an article for my college newspaper in which I joked that one day, the lefties would boycott the word "boycott" for its gender implication. That was in 2019. I thought it was a decent joke. I never expected anything like it to actually happen. But alas, satire has become reality, my friends.

Sam Smith appeared on BBC's The One Show and discussed their love of fishing, in between all the Satanic performances and latex glove fittings. But Smith clarified they would be a fisherthem. Not a fisherman. Because gender. Or Something.

\u201cSam Smith says he loves fishing and identifies as a FisherTHEM not a Fishermen but a Fisherthem \ud83c\udfa3\ud83e\udd26\ud83c\udffc\u200d\u2642\ufe0f\ud83d\ude11\u201d
— Oli London (@Oli London) 1676420654

Smith explained, "I love fishing! Yes, I do! Yeah I'd love to be a fisherthem!"

Smith was then misgendered by the host, who asked, "What? Like a fly fisherman?" Smith responded they'd like to be any type of fisherTHEM, thank you very much.

This is actually the third time Smith has been misgendered by BBC in the past two months. I, for one, don't understand how it could possibly keep happening. Smith is so clearly a "them". Not confusing at all to refer to a single person as multiple beings. Not even a little bit.

Smith came out as non-binary and genderqueer in 2019, when he explained to Jameela Jamil: "I've always had a little bit of a war going within my body and my mind. I do think like a woman sometimes, in my head. Sometimes I’ve questioned, ‘Do I want a sex change?’ and it’s something I still think about, like: ‘Do I want to?' But I don’t think it is. When I saw the words’ non-binary’ and ‘genderqueer’ and I read into it, and I heard this person speaking, I was like ‘F*ck, that’s me.'”

To be completely honest, I still don't understand what non-binary or genderqueer or any of the other gender spectrum terms actually mean. But I'll take this fisherthem's word for it.

title: WATCH: Preschool Teacher Explains How He Wears a Skirt to Class to 'Challenge Stereotypes'
description:
One day, in our formerly-sane country, everyone agreed that you shouldn't talk to children about anything age-inappropriate. It now seems like one day in the near future, we'll be hard-pressed to find a school that isn't allowing teachers to tell their three-year-old students all about who they like to bang. Is this the "new normal" our overlords keep telling us about? If so, I want no part of it. Thanks though.

Last month, a clip from a documentary shown to North Carolina daycare owners began circulating online. The clip featured a nonbinary teacher showing their students a nonbinary doll named Nash. The teacher, of course, went on to explain that Nash isn't a boy or girl, a concept that sparked much confusion amongst the 4-year-old audience, whose main concern prior to this lesson was whether to have goldfish or pretzels at snack time.

The Washington Free Beacon put out a full report on the documentary yesterday, and it's a doozy. The film featured a teacher explaining how he wears a skirt to class to "challenge stereotypes" and help children feel "safe to be whoever they want to be". Another teacher explained how the young children made BLM signs and held a protest at the school.

\u201cA male teacher tells the children that \u201cI want to wear a skirt, I want to make sure I feel safe wearing a skirt.\u201d\n\n\u201cI just want you to know that sometimes I wear a skirt, it\u2019s really comfortable, I like it, I like to spin around in it\u201d\u201d
— Washington Free Beacon (@Washington Free Beacon) 1676471379

The documentary was filmed at Epiphany Early Learning Preschool & Southwest Early Learning Bilingual Preschool in Seattle & Pacific Primary School in San Francisco. One of the producers said that "there are no scripts or actors in the film" and that "these are real teachers in real classrooms."

In North Carolina, the conference it was shown at was required for child care professionals to remain licensed in the state, and this specific documentary was mandatory for all participants.

So to all you parents out there, it's probably a good idea to be heavily involved in your child's education and schooling. There really is a secret agenda brewing in our nation's public schools. Make sure you know and trust all of your child's teachers. Otherwise, a dude in a skirt might show up one day to "challenge stereotypes".

title: LOL: Chris Cuomo Said He Was Homicidal After CNN Fired Him But It's Just Because He's Italian
description:
It's been over a year since Chris Cuomo graced America's nighttime television screens. That is if you're one of the six people who watch CNN. If so, I advise you to please stop for your own well-being and the good of society.

Anywho, despite the time since his departure, it seems Chris still hasn't quite gotten over it. On a recent podcast, he discussed his feelings about the whole matter. Specifically that he wanted to kill everyone and himself.

Seems like a bit of an overreaction.

\u201c\ud83d\udea8BREAKING: Chris Cuomo: \u201cI was going to kill everybody and myself\u201d after being fired from CNN.\u201d
— Benny Johnson (@Benny Johnson) 1676493188

He went on to blame his homicidal tendencies on his Italian heritage, saying, "Italians are so passionate and I really had to fight against that because... I got too many people counting on me."

Well, yes, it's usually a good thing to resist the urge to murder. Even if you aren't Italian.

Cuomo also said he sought therapy after his firing and is dealing with some "unrelatable damage". As a refresher, got canned back in 2021 after a sexual assault allegation surfaced. He had already been placed on suspension for providing PR assistance to his brother Andrew for his sexual assault allegations. Specifically, Chris drafted emails for Andrew denying the allegations against him. Just a slight conflict of interest there.

Even before all the sexual assault allegations, Chris was not very slick in his soft-balling Andrew. Who could forget the infamous segment where, while Andy was busy killing nursing home residents with asinine Covid policies, the Cuomo bros... joked about their mom. Really asking the tough questions.

\u201cCHRIS CUOMO: There's always time to call mom. She wants to hear from you. Just so you know.\n\nANDREW CUOMO: I called mom just before I came on this show. By the way, she said I was her favorite. Good news is she said you are her second favorite. Second favorite son, Christopher.\u201d
— JM Rieger (@JM Rieger) 1584408891

Despite the multitude of misdoings, Chris said he feels his job was taken wrongly and has since filed a $125 million arbitration claim against CNN for "smearing" his journalistic integrity. Chris, buddy, I hate to break it to ya, but you did that all on your own. With a little help from Andrew.

title: Watch: Karen demands to speak to Little Caesars manager, has epic meltdown over employee *checks notes* throwing out cardboard
description:
Poor Justin. He's not having as bad of a day as Walter. No one knows what happened to Walter. But Justin still regrets going to work. All he wants to do is make some pizza. Instead, he has Karen screaming at him about how Little Caesars employees don't care about the environment. Something about throwing out cardboard boxes.

Karen is the one screaming about how Justin is now on Facebook Live. Like every Karen who has come before her, she lacks the self-awareness to know that she is in fact the asshole in this situation.

pic.twitter.com/zTcEFkyyuY
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) February 15, 2023

The real victim is my man here who just wants his Crazy Bread.

As far as I can tell an employee -- we'll call him Bob -- was throwing out garbage. Karen didn't like the garbage Bob was throwing out so she followed him into the restaurant screaming, asking for a manager. Yes, "Karen" ackshually asked for a manager! That manager being Justin.

After screaming "Facebook LIVE" eleventy times. Karen let Justin know what the sand up her vagina was all about.

You don't care about the environment. We have one Earth. You don't give a sh*t about it. We have one f*cking Earth. Respect it, b*tch. It houses you. It holds you. It f*cking makes sure you're good.

Not the worst pizza joint meltdown we've seen. That's this guy.

A Toronto man destroyed a pizza display because another customer was not wearing a mask 😱-📹 u/RxdditRoamxr #Toronto #COVIDIOT #COVID19Ontario pic.twitter.com/4ks86Lbh35
— blogTO (@blogTO) July 31, 2020

But the wannabe-Greta enviro-slacktivism definitely ranks Karen in the top 3. I'd be curious to know what specific incident set Karen off. Was she walking down the street and happened to notice the act of garbage being thrown out? Or was she patrolling the area on "FACEBOOK LIVE! FACEBOOK LIVE! FACEBOOK LIVE!" looking for any transgressor? Poor Bob happened to be at the wrong dumpster at the wrong time.

Editor’s Note

title: 'You won't be missed': Elon Musk declares cancel culture dead after watching this Joe Rogan clip
description:
There have been a lot less of "cancel x" or "x is over party" trends on the bird app after Elon Musk fired the bitterly partisan, commie as f*ck nincompoops who decided what was allowed to trend on Twitter. Whether the two are related or it's mere irony everyone decided to pull the giant metal rod out of their rectums at the same time those people were fired is up for debate. Elon says the debate is settled. As does his BFF Joe Rogan and Matt Taibbi, one of the non-corporate journalists Musk has opened the books to.

This clip from the Joe Rogan Experience is going viral where Joe and Matt discuss the noticeable changes.

Matt Taibbi & Joe Rogan on Twitter 2.0 and the Fall of Cancel Culture

“The old Twitter was just a grindstone of official messaging” @mtaibbi @joerogan @elonmusk pic.twitter.com/rVohauHZxS
— Chief Nerd (@TheChiefNerd) February 14, 2023

Elon has used the clip as a reason to declare an end to cancel culture.

RIP Cancel Culture, you won’t be missed
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) February 14, 2023

I think the death of cancel culture is premature. As long as everyone in the media and the news entertainment clickbait complex all skews the in the same political direction, cancel culture will always be with us. But without Twitter employees putting their thumb on the scale over who gets canceled and whose tweets calling for someone to get canceled are amplified, there will be a lot less of it.

Look no further than the regular target of "cancelation" Chris Pratt. Prior to Elon buying Twitter, all it took was Pratt showing up in the Thor trailer for "Twitter" to "demand" Pratt be canceled. Or, when the actor would post something about his family. You see, the knock on Pratt (by idiots) is that he likes Jesus, America, and hunting. And because he uses his platform to make millions of people happy and NOT attack Trump supporters, leftists hate him. Yet a few movie trailers and a few more Instagram posts about how much he loves his wife later, no one has tried "canceling" him after Elon took over.

It's not just a lack of Cancelling Chris. Japanese Twitter users noticed after a reporter complained she had no one left at Twitter to call anymore to make sure her "news" articles trended, the bird app was becoming more pleasant:

Users appear to consider the new trending list as more authentic than the politics-infused list allegedly curated by Twitter, which is a fair assumption. Japanese users have compared this list to previous days where almost all trending topics were political in nature. The user who posted the list called the new trends “peaceful” and joked about how the curation team must have spend their time “sorting out topics like this every day”.

It turns out that when Twitter employees don't have their finger on the scale, Twitter users don't care about the political topics those Twitter employees want them to be outraged over. Without Twitter's thumb on the scale amplifying outrage tweets over the tweets of people criticizing the outrage, lazy journalismers have less to write about.

Editor’s Note

title: Watch: GOP lawmaker is met with awkward silence when he asks hearing witness about - her - penis
description:
At an Arkansas hearing over strengthening malpractice rights for patients, a GOP lawmaker caught everyone off guard by asking a witness about their genitalia. Matt McKee, believed to be a cis male, is a republican state senator. Dr. Gwendolyn Herzig is a beautiful and brave transgender healthcare professional who opposes the strengthened malpractice protections.

McKee pointed out how Herzig is now a transwoman who is believed to have been a man at one point. The senator was curious. "You said that you're a trans woman? Do you have a penis?"

Awkward silence was quickly met with jeers and outrage.

The surreal moment when Republican Arkansas state Sen. Matt McKee asks a trans pharmacist if she has a penis. pic.twitter.com/7reE9porVW
— The Indoctrinatrix (@gelderbailey) February 13, 2023

The hearing was for Senate Bill 199. It would allow minors who had permanent, life-altering, irreversible, genital mutilation procedures up to thirty years past their eighteenth birthday the ability to sue for malpractice. Critics who oppose these increased malpractice rights, like Dr. Herzig, view these permanent, life-altering, irreversible, genital mutilation procedures as "gender-affirming care." And believe not encouraging and celebrating the procedure makes you transphobic.

Republican Sen. Gary Stubblefield, the official behind the increased malpractice rights, says this legislation is aimed at forcing medical providers to stop offering what some call "gender-affirming care" to minors.

The idea that teenagers, let alone little children, are capable of making such life-altering decisions is not only brand new, but it's absurd. A society that allows them to do this is a deeply broken society.

It's part of a broader debate that has grown contentious. Supporters who claim without evidence these procedures are "gender-affirming care" recently staged an insurrection at the Oklahoma capitol. The debate has also taken over scholastic sports, where women born that way believe newer women both with lots of testosterone have an unfair advantage. They also believe it's inappropriate for those women to walk around the locker room with their dicks out.

Unclear is what Dr. Herzig's presumed penis has to do with the debate over Senate Bill 199. Or why Sen. McKee asked.

Editor’s Note

title: Watch: Guy finds out the pretzel stand ran out of his favorite item and his violent rage is a bit of an overreaction
description:
Everyone throughout all of the United States of the Americas knows Auntie Anne's is the Cadillac of mall food court eateries. Sbarro is in the mix you don't live in New York where we have real pizza. The undisputed champion is still that buttery pretzel goodness. While it's good, it's not beat the crap out of an employee because they ran out of cinnamon nuggets good.

A pretzel ain’t never make me act like this 😂 pic.twitter.com/YKGKDsYeSF
— ATL Uncensored | Atlanta News (@ATLUncensored) February 8, 2023

I used to work in an Express with an Auntie Anne's right outside. Whenever the free sample girl would have a plate of cinnamon nuggets, I'd throw her a wink to bring the plate a little closer. They're delicious, I get it. Auntie Anne's hotdogs wrapped in a pretzel reign supreme. Cinnamon nuggets are a close number two. Neither is worth wildin' out when you can't get any.

The pretzel stand didn't even run out of the item, as local news reports. They only ran out of the item in a small. The customer went bananas. He crossed the counter, which you never do. The employee was in fight or flight mode, armed with only a pair of metal tongs.

The employee is ready to sue the mall over the incident. Working in the mall is enough of an indignity without having to get your hair pulled over fried dough dipped in cinnamon sugar.

I’m looking to press charges on the mall because you guys pay for security there was no security around even afterwards.

Look on the bright side. Worse would be security present, but instead of helping you they are more concerned with the feelings of the aggressor.

The real crime in this entire unfortunate incident? It's made me hungry. And my local mall closed, so there isn't an Auntie Anne's nearby.

Editor’s Note
